entry.value: Splits a String into separate values by a given split character e.g. | and filters all rows that contain less elements than specified.

%%00009//***********************************************%%00010%%00009//Specifiy the row length and the split character%%00010%%00009//***********************************************%%00010%%00009final int rowLength = 14;%%00010%%00009final String splitCharacter = "\\|";%%00010%%00010%%00010%%00009//Filters all rows from the RDD that do not have the given length%%00010%%00009JavaRDD<Row> result = rowRDD1.filter(new Function<Row, Boolean>(){%%00010 %%00009private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;%%00010 @Override%%00010 public Boolean call(Row r) throws Exception {%%00010 %%00009//read the first entry of the row that contains the String%%00010 %%00009//to split and filter%%00010 %%00009String s = r.getString(0);%%00010 %%00009//Split the string using the splitCharacter into a String array%%00010%%00009%%00009String[] vals = s.split(splitCharacter);%%00010%%00009%%00009//return true if the array has rowLength number of elements%%00010%%00009%%00009return vals.length == rowLength;%%00010 }});%%00010%%00009return result;
